title: Media playback no audio
content: Windows 10 22H2. A few of days ago Firefox stopped playing any audio. Video still works but even audio only streams produce no volume. As far as I've checked its only Firefox. All other browsers and media apps play sounds fine. Tried all the solutions in the help article article . No luck. I have been using Firefox for 8 years now. Unfortunately, it seems I will have to abandon it soon. A lot of websites don't have compatibility with Firefox and now this. Hopefully there's a simple solution and soon. It would be sad to see you go.
creator: hello.mioko

title: Clickable keypad doesn't show correctly
content: A website I have to use for my work (for the Queensland Department of Education) requires that I input a 6-digit code; for *security*, they insist it be input by clicking on a keypad that scrambles the position of the number keys each time... It's meant to look like the first image attached below, but when I try to open it in Firefox, it looks like the second image and I can't input my code. I'd like to be able to use Firefox for EVERYTHING but I end up having to use Chrome to access this site, which I use pretty much every day for work, and it's very inconvenient.
creator: nycarrington

title: MS Edge taking charge of html links from Twitter.
content:
I'm running Windows 11 and links to html files from the Twitter app always open in MS Edge, not in Firefox, which is set as my default application. I checked in the preferred app dialog and found that firefox is set as preferred browser for almost all applications. Interestingly, when I manually copied one of the troublesome links (which Twitter had encoded as a random string) into firefox, it worked fine.

I don't know if the problem is in Windows 11 or the Twitter app. Any suggestions to keep my connections on Firefox would be greatly appreciated.
creator: stephen.mccluskey

title: Firefox can't remember Weibo's logged in state and I have to log in manually every couple of days (doesn't happen with other websites)
content:
Like the title suggests, Firefox won't remember my Weibo.com login state. Every couple of days, I have to log in again. This does not happen with other social media sites, i.e. Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, etc. Only Weibo is having this problem, even though I allowed cookies from weibo.com.

What's more, Chrome does not have this issue with weibo.com.
creator: yileibao1998

title: Signing in - everytime it ask for a new password then refuses to accept it - have to go through 15 (or minutes) changing passwords and still can't open Firefox.
content: Why do I have to change or make a new password every time I try to sign into Firefox - all my passwords have been deleted and then don't work the next time I try to sign in. Also I have the same e-mail address since 1968, yet now yahoo/firefox doesn't recognize it ?
creator: utoyca

title: Multi Account Container Tab Cookies Exception
content:
I have the Multi Account Container Extension I also have "Clear cookies and site data when Firefox is closed" checked

How to add a cookie exception for a container? I can add cookies exceptions but they apply to whole browser, I don't want youtube cookies stored in my browser when using default container. I want them stored only in youtube container
creator: firefoxacc.tus6e

title: ¿Cómo deshabilito que la ventana de descargas se abra automáticamente?
content:
Cuando descargo algo, el documento se abre automáticamente, cortando el flujo cuando necesito descargar muchos archivos.

¿Habrá alguna forma de desactivar esta función?, para que no se abra cada vez que descargo algo
creator: danielita_dlm

title: [Macbook, Ventura] Friefox always opens .pdf's in a new window and not in a new tab.
content:
Hello,

I searched the web for answers but couldn't find any. I set firefox to be the default app to open .pdf-files on my macbook. And everytime I open a file, firefox opens a new window.

How can I make sure that a .pdf-file opens in the current window as a new tab?

On Safari this works as intended. On every other OS this works as intedend.

Thanks for time.
creator: julian.hinrichs44
